content: Warning through Visions

Then I said,
“Lord , please stop!
How can Jacob stand?
For he is small.”
The  relented of this.
“This too shall not be,” said the Lord .
So He showed me, and behold, the Lord was standing by a vertical wall with a plumb line in His hand.
And the  said to me, “What do you see, Amos?” And I said, “A plumb line.” Then the Lord said,
“Behold I am about to put a plumb line
In the midst of My people Israel.
I will not spare them any longer.
The high places of Isaac will become deserted,
And the sanctuaries of Israel will be in ruins.
Then I will rise up against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.”
Amos Accused; Gives an Answer
Then Amaziah, the priest of Bethel, sent  to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you in the midst of the house of Israel; the land is unable to endure all his words.
For this is what Amos says: ‘Jeroboam will die by the sword, and Israel will certainly go from its land into exile.’”
Then Amaziah said to Amos, “Go, you seer, flee to the land of Judah; and eat bread there and do your prophesying there!
But do not prophesy at Bethel any longer, for it is a sanctuary of the king and a royal residence.”
Then Amos replied to Amaziah, “I am not a prophet, nor am I the son of a prophet; for I am a herdsman and a grower of sycamore figs.
But the  took me from following the flock, and the  said to me, ‘Go prophesy to My people Israel.’
So now hear the word of the : you are saying, ‘You shall not prophesy against Israel nor shall you prophesy against the house of Isaac.’

Therefore, this is what the  says: ‘Your wife will become a prostitute in the city, your sons and your daughters will fall by the sword, your land will be parceled up by a  line, and you yourself will die upon unclean soil. Furthermore Israel will certainly go from its land into exile.’”
